alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Inland; Mobile Inland; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 29 at 10:11AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following areas, in Alabama, Baldwin Inland, Choctaw, Clarke, Mobile Inland, Monroe, Washington and Wilcox. In southeast Mississippi, George, Greene, Perry, Stone and Wayne. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall is expected across portions of southeastern Mississippi and southwestern Alabama. Multiple rounds of training thunderstorms will produce upwards of three to five inches of rainfall with locally higher totals possible. This could result in areas of flash flooding across most of the area, with significant flash flooding possible for areas northwest of the I-65 corridor this afternoon through early Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Baldwin Inland; Mobile Inland; Monroe; Wilcox
